item.title: Dropbox Webhooks
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Dropbox launched support for webhooks. This is a great move. Amazon S3 does have something similar. You can enable notifications via their Simple Notification Service ( SNS ), but then you are charged for the SNS usage. For many people that will make it less appealing than traditional direct webhooks. Dropbox continues to use a […]
item.content:encoded:
Dropbox launched support for webhooks. This is a great move.

Amazon S3 does have something similar. You can enable notifications via their Simple Notification Service ( SNS ), but then you are charged for the SNS usage. For many people that will make it less appealing than traditional direct webhooks.

Dropbox continues to use a mix of Amazon Web Services ( AWS ) and separate dedicated hardware to manage user file. I wonder if they are using any AWS services to process what are likely millions of HTTP requests for webhooks.

item.title: Webhooks on WordPress.com
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: I’m thrilled to have webhooks on WordPress.com open for everyone today! Eoin Gallagher and I used mitcho‘s HookPress WordPress plugin for this. I’ve been talking with mitcho and he’ll be incorporating some of our changes in the next release of HookPress. This is one of those foundational technologies that I’m really excited to have launched […]
item.content:encoded:
I’m thrilled to have webhooks on WordPress.com open for everyone today! Eoin Gallagher and I used mitcho‘s HookPress WordPress plugin for this. I’ve been talking with mitcho and he’ll be incorporating some of our changes in the next release of HookPress.

This is one of those foundational technologies that I’m really excited to have launched and even more excited to see what people us it for.
